description: I use it to watch Youtube videos on MPV player with subtitles.
It's so cool! It works really well with english videos and movies! I can't wait for it to support more language!
should be able to see through it
summary: cool but it should be a bit transparent

description: This application impresses me! It has a stunning design that follows the modern GNOME design guidelines, and it is ready to go almost immediately after installation. It works really well for videos and podcasts, and has a reasonable amount of nice-to-have features and configuration options. Well done!
The captions appear instantaneously for every single word. Fast and does not consume a lot of resources. Very great job! 👏
summary: Amazed by such a seemingly "simple" app

description: This already works really well, and it's amazing that it works completely locally! I appreciate how easy it was to start using it.

Really impressed with the captioning, sometimes stumbles with some non standard English like names of characters but good with different accents.
It's got the ability to capture from both apps and voice input which is very cool and think it'll take a while for the novelty to wear off.
Might be nice to have the option to log the text to a file but that's probably the job of a dedicated app.
Also like how it shows off the flexibility of libadwaita as it's minimal but still fits in with the system theme.
I would love to use this for meetings cause it works suprisingly well but for that it should be capable of outputing the text in some way
summary: Works suprisingly well but lacks one key feature

description:
so cool app
works out of the box
Works effortlessly without any fuss whatsoever. Glad to see more accesibility tools coming to the Linux desktop world
Has good accuracy for an AI. It of course makes many mistakes, but is as good as the competition.
It'd be really cool to see Mycroft take advantage of something like this.
Works well, but the fact that it doesn't support other languages is a dealbreaker for me.

This tool is amazing especially if you have adhd, its low taxing so it doesnt slow other games down. it even can distinguish tones! this is very helpful for me as i have severe adhd and have trouble understanding some things. if only this could be put on AR glasses

-works on steam deck
Very simple app! Honestly better than the defaut YouTube Captions

summary: Works good and has a great story behind the creation, link in review

description: I'm very impressed how accurate the result is. Especially because English is not my native language.
summary: Just awesome! Works like a charm for me
